title: The reason everyone builds pure damage

replies.body:
the reason is obvious... damage is so high right now that  if u  have 1500 hp it doesn't matter if u die because two 1.1k damage abilities hit you.. or if two 1.8 k damage abilities hit you... you STILL die in two hits...
 THAT is why no one bother building defense

 because your ALREADY going to die...

it doesn't matter if u get 1 shot by 2000 damage or if u get 1 shot by 8000 damage... as long as u still die... IT DOESN'T MATTER.

 so whats the point of defense?

 the TERM "one shot" in season 3.. meant.. "using your entire kit to blow up a half hp target in less than 2 seconds"

it didn't _actually_ mean KILL THEM ONE ONE ABILITY.

 as a mid laner.. u would TRADE damage in lane.. 

 it wasn't "oh i either killed you or you're so low your forced to back"

the only lane that ever TRADES anymore is top lane at early levels

 "tower diving" used to only be a thing from {{champion:38}} {{champion:238}}  and {{champion:7}} 

 and event then it was RISKY

 it wasn't something every champion and their mom could do with even a slight lead.


 for a multiple person tower dive u had to properly juggle aggro between targets and swap who was taking turret fire or you would die... 
 u couldn't just "take 20 tower shots with a tank"

im not going to site here and pretend riot hasn't made improvements to the game..
 they have...

 they have made  quite a very FEW GOOD improvements

we can pick our roles we can hover our pick, 
we can ping items to show how much gold we need to complete them,
we can ping cooldowns
 we can see allied ultimate cooldown (when its not bugged)
we can see buff timers
we can see jungle camps spawning on the map
 a bunch of champions got new improve skins, splash arts, and LORE
we have an ACTUAL IN CLIENT REPLAY
 
I'm not going to sit here and pretend riot hasn't made some AMAZING improvements. these are all thing we as the community have asked for for YEARS and finally were given

 but the BALANCE of the game has gotten _HORRIFICALLY_ WORSE.

THAT is the issue

some people hate plants.. and while i dislike  most of them.. i DO _very much_ like the blast cones, in fact i LOVE the blast cones.

i think  the honey-fruit is pretty meh, especially now where its not safe to go in riven when your low where it used to be a place where u would heal off fruit and scuttle.

 and i think the vision cone plant in the majority of cases does more HARM than good because it reveals your own location.

 but the issue is riot BALANCE..

Yes, damage creep is heavily a result of the creation of these champions back around season 3, who were given mobility as their only necessary for of "defense". 
No other champion had a full aspect of the gameplay subsidized back then until the "assassin fantasy" was legitimized by riot. Everyone had their specializations, but most still had to account for the rest of the game's mechanics when optimizing. Where as assassins were given an infinite "skill ceiling" for defense and then just left to optimize for damage. 

Since then classes like tank and marksmen have followed suit as riot forcibly polarizes classes into their niche. Not only homogenizing them, but removing the flexibility of the middle ground in the process.

meh I think we are just in a meta stuck logic. If you had a team that took zac jungle and mao top and they built pure tank they would get and feel tanky. People are just told that the meta is pure damage so they do it and when it works they use confirmation bias to back it up. Tanks are fine. People just need to pick them.

You misunderstand. The reason that every non-tank builds pure damage, is because of these champions. Which means that while actual tanks who have been slowly given additional scaling with defensive stats over the years (the most recent I remember is amumu), scaling that they didn't previously need, building defense can still work. Where as non-tanks are forced into building pure damage without any actual defense because the assassins scale multiplicative with damage and the tanks scale multiplicative with defense. 

So if you're a primarily damage class, then building any amount of dedicated tankiness makes you incapable of killing a tank and no better at surviving against an assassin.
And conversely a primarily defensive class building some damage, will lose substantially more tankiness than they'd gain in building even a small amount of dedicated damage items.

I think it's more of an issue that power creep has come so far that even if you're behind, it's better to continue building damage. Unless you're a tank and you have the base stats and abilities to back it up, you're just better off building straight up damage.

It's funny because this 
> even if you're behind, it's better to continue building damage

use to be the opposite xD

But yes, power creep is the issue, but it's brought about by the polarizing nature of introducing a class (or particular champions), which are encouraged to build with no regard for their own offensive/defensive balance.
